    • precedence

      public java.lang.Boolean precedence​(char operator1, char operator2)
      this function tells which parameter has higher precedence.
      Parameters:
      operator1 - char
      operator2 - char
      Returns:
      true if operator1 has higher precedence or has the same precedence as operator2 otherwise it returns false

    • bracket

      public java.lang.Object[] bracket​(java.lang.String expression)
      This function helps me in the negative bracket in my expression.
      Parameters:
      expression - String
      Returns:
      an object array that contains the string which is the complete bracket and the counter 'number of characters in the string

    • operator

      public int operator​(char operator)
      This function determines whether the character given to it is an operator. open bracket ,closed bracket , space or a special char "Symbol like @ #"
      Parameters:
      operator - character
      Returns:
      0 if the char is a digit or a letter ,returns 1 if the char is open bracket, returns 2 if the char is a close bracket, returns 3 if the char is a valid operator, returns 4 if space and returns 5 if the char is neither a digit nor a letter

    • number

      public java.lang.Object[] number​(java.lang.String expression)
      This function helps me handle numbers with more than one digit.
      Parameters:
      expression - String
      Returns:
      an object array containing the string which is the number and the counter which is the size if the string

    • checkString

      public java.lang.String checkString​(java.lang.String expression)
      In this function i handled the expression the user puts if there are errors. in the expression and handled the negative sign with dummy zero
      Parameters:
      expression - String
      Returns:
      The correct handled expression with negative numbers as (0-num) and returns null in case of the expression being wrong

    • infixToPostfix

      public java.lang.String infixToPostfix​(java.lang.String expression)
      Description copied from interface: IExpressionEvaluator
      Takes a symbolic/numeric infix expression as input and converts it to postfix notation. There is no assumption on spaces between terms or the length of the term (e.g., two digits symbolic or numeric term)
      Specified by:
      infixToPostfix in interface IExpressionEvaluator
      Parameters:
      expression - infix expression
      Returns:
      postfix expression

    • evaluate

      public int evaluate​(java.lang.String expression)
      Description copied from interface: IExpressionEvaluator
      Evaluate a postfix numeric expression, with a single space separator
      Specified by:
      evaluate in interface IExpressionEvaluator
      Parameters:
      expression - postfix expression
      Returns:
      the expression evaluated value
